snippet: In a February article titled "Jon Corzine's Riskiest Business," Vanity Fair reporters said that the former governor of New Jersey saw MF Global as a stepping stone to becoming Treasury secretary. In a letter to the magazine, Mr. Corzine's children...
abstract: In a February article titled "Jon Corzine's Riskiest Business," Vanity Fair reporters said that the former governor of New Jersey saw MF Global as a stepping stone to becoming Treasury secretary. In a letter to the magazine, Mr. Corzine's children protested "the sweeping negative narrative the authors use to describe our family."

headline.main: The Corzine Family's Letter to Vanity Fair
